PC 12 Systems Summary
Landing gear type and shock absorption system.
Tricycle retractable landing gear, hydraulically actuated, with mechanical down locks for the down position. Gear is held in the retracted position by hydraulic pressure. Loss of pressure will cause the gear to free fall. (after 200 minutes in the event of a power pack failure). Gear doors are spring loaded to the open position. Shock is absorbed through the pistons in the landing gear.
Brake system description.
Each main gear wheel is equipped with a hydraulically actuated single-disc brake on the inboard side of each wheel. The brake system is separate and independent from the aircraft hydraulic system. Whoever applies the most pressure will control the brakes between the two pilots.
Number of fuel nozzles and operation.
There are 14 duplex type fuel nozzles with each nozzle incorporating a primary and secondary valve. During engine start, the primary flow begins as soon as there is fuel pressure. The secondary flow kicks in above approximately 45% N.G. . Without the secondary flow, the engine will hang at 40 to 45% N.G. during start. For operations from normal idle through max power, all 14 nozzles function with fuel coming through both the primary and secondary valves.
Air induction system.
The engine air inlet is located at the front of the engine under the propeller spinner. Ram air entering the inlet flows through the ducting and an inertial separator system. It then enters the engine through a circular plenum chamber where it is directed to the compressor by guide vanes. The compressor air inlet incorporates a screen that will prevent the entry of large particles but does not filter the inlet air.
Compressor bleed system, compressor surge control, and system operation.
The compressor bleed valve system operates between 86 to 92% N.G. to prevent the axial compressor from overloading the centrifugal compressor at low RPMs, causing a compressor stall. (the axial compressor is more efficient at lower RPMs). The valve is located between the second and third axial stage. (P 2 point 5). P 3. ( the third stage axial compressor). air is conditioned. (depressurized). into P.X, which acts against the bypass valve to close the spring loaded valve as engine speed (and P 3 pressure) increases. The spring loaded valve opens when the engine speed drops below 92% until it is fully opened at 86%. Also, some of the heated P 2 point 5 air that is ducted out of the compressor section can be routed to the cabin and defroster for climate control during ground operations.
Fuel’s path through the fuel system.
Main tanks transfer jet pump collector tank delivery jet pump maintenance shutoff valve fuel filter/bypass air separator/low pressure sensor low-pressure switch cabin firewall shutoff engine driven low pressure pump/bypass fuel/oil heat exchanger engine driven high pressure pump filter/bypass Fuel Control Unit fuel flow transducer fuel flow divider 14 duplex nozzles.
Prevention of water freezing in the fuel system.
Water freezing in the fuel system is prevented by the fuel/oil heat exchanger, which routes hot oil into the exchanger via a heat sensing mechanical bypass valve. The addition of PRIST anti-icing fuel additive prevents icing in the fuel system prior to the heat exchanger.
What happens if the fuel filter is blocked.
A red button will extend above the top of the fuel filter facing the bay door, thus indicating the filter is being bypassed. This has a preset to open at a pressure of 8 PSI. Maintenance will reset the button once the issue is resolved.
Number of fuel sensors in the fuel tanks.
10 total, 4 capacitance probes in each main tank and 1 in each collector tank. Fuel is measured in pounds.
At what measured tank level do the CAWS L/R FUEL LOW lights come on?
When the respective tank runs below 20 gallons.
In addition to the transfer pump in the main tank, how can fuel transfer to the collector tank?
Via gravity feed through the flapper check valve.
What internal tank pressure is maintained by the fuel venting system?
Negative 0.2 to 2.0 PSI
What is the flow rate of the electric boost pumps?
91.3 gallons per hour.
What pressure between the collector tank and engine driven fuel pump will activate the amber FUEL PRESS light?
When fuel pressure falls below 2.0 PSI.
Function of the Fuel Control Unit.
The FCU determines the correct fuel schedule to produce desired engine power in response to the Power Control Lever, (PCL), and Condition lever movement in normal operations, or Manual Override lever, (M.O.R), movement during emergency operations.
How does the FCU, (through power control manipulation), control fuel flow?
The FCU power lever acts upon a pneumatic bellow which then increases or decreases the amount of fuel flow at a given rate, (this prevents a runaway in the fuel supply delta for the turbine engine). P3 air acts upon the N.G. governor, (which conditions the P3 air to P.Y. pressure) , and the bellows, to increase or decrease fuel flow as the power setting is altered, thus changing the P3 pressure, (and therefore the P.Y. pressure being applied to the bellows).
What is the function of the flow divider?
Divides metered fuel flow between the primary and secondary fuel manifolds as a function of fuel pressure.
How is residual fuel purged from the fuel manifold and nozzles during engine shutdown?
Both the primary and secondary fuel distribution manifolds close, and a P3 air pressure accumulator expels the fuel into the combustion chamber, where it is burned off.
What is the first indication when the prop transfers from Beta to Reverse Range?
You will hear/see an increase in power.
Primary propellor governor.
The Primary governor limits N.P. to 1700 RPM or 104% N.G.. It uses a speeder spring to regulate the supply of engine oil to the pitch change mechanism within the prop hub. The governor is shaft driven via the bevel gear which is fitted to the propeller shaft.
Overspeed propellor governor.
In the event of a primary governor failure, the Overspeed governor will limit N.P. to eighteen oh two RPM or 106% N.P. . Uses its own speeder spring and flyweights to detect an overspeed condition and regulate the supply of engine oil to the pitch change mechanism within the prop hub.
Fuel Topping propellor governor
The N.F. or fuel topping governor limits N.P. to eighteen fifty three RPM or 109% N.P. . It does this by limiting the fuel flow via the FCU by using an air-bleed lever, a P.Y. bleed orifice and lever, and a reset arm. The Nf governor also acts as the primary governor while in reverse.
When oil pressure in the prop hub is insufficient to oppose the feathering spring and counterweights, how is blade pitch affected?
Pitch increases.
How is the propellor feathered?
Condition lever is set to Cut Off / Feather, uses the Overspeed Governor to dump oil pressure from the prop hub, requires power from the Battery Bus.
How many spark igniters are in the engine, and where are they?
There are two spark igniters, at the 4 and 9 o'clock positions of the gas generator case.
What is ITT and how is it measured.
Interturbine temperature; sensed by ten thermocouple probes exposed to combustion gas flow passing between the compressor turbine and the power turbines.
Engine lubrication system.
The oil system is a closed loop, dry sump, with a single pressure element system that provides cooling and lubrication to engine bearings and the accessory gearbox. The oil system also provides heating to the fuel, as well as oil to the torque limiter and meter. Oil cooling is accomplished with the oil/fuel heat exchanger and a ram air oil cooler.
Starter behavior as N.G. accelerates during start.
Starter cutoff at or above 50% N.G. . It becomes a generator once the gen 1 switch is turned to the ON position.
What is powered by the Accessory Gear Box?
Starter/Generator 1, Generator 2, Oil pressure and scavenger pumps, Fuel Control Unit (FCU), high and low pressure fuel pumps, N.G. tachometer, fuel/oil heat exchanger
What does the compressor assembly consist of?
A four-stage axial compressor, a single-stage centrifugal impeller, and four stator vane assemblies.
Viewed from the cockpit, in which direction do the compressor turbine and power turbines rotate?
Counterclockwise and clockwise.
Function of the turbine guide vanes.
They ensure that the exhaust gases impinge the turbine blades at the optimal angle in order to capture the maximum amount of energy.
When will auto-ignition engage?
When I.T.T drops below 500 Celsius and N​.G.​ above 10%, prevents flameout at low power settings
How does the fire detection system work?
Consists of a closed tube containing helium with a central hydrogen core, when heated, the helium pressure increases and actuates the fire pressure switch. When heated intensely over a short period, the hydrogen is released, causing a pressure rise actuating the fire pressure switch. When the sensor tube is cooled, the average gas pressure is lowered, and the discrete hydrogen gas returns to the core material.
What design feature counteracts the effects of engine torque and control surface trim changes during flight?
The engine is installed 2 degrees to the right and 2 degrees down from the fuselage centerline.
Forward pressure bulkhead composition.
Titanium, covered with a fire insulation blanket
Battery endurance in the event of power generation loss.
20 minutes at 60 amps, 30 minutes at 50 amps. Double times for a dual battery aircraft.
M.E.L. vs ninety one two zero five.
If an M.E.L. is supplied for aircraft operations, it supersedes ninety one two zero five.
What changes to configuration and performance are there when taking off into known icing conditions?
Flaps must be set to 15 and rotation speed increased by 9 knots. Takeoff ground roll distance increases by 30%.
What is unique about the stabilizer trim?
It utilizes two motors. The main motor is used when manually trimming, and the secondary motor is used for autotrim or alternate stabilizer trim.
When will the stick shaker and stick pusher activate?
Stick shaker will activate 5 to 10 knots above pusher (only requires one A.O.A channel). Stick pusher will activate 2 to 5 knots above stall, (requires both A.O.A channels).
Flap circuit breaker operation.
Pops when the motor overheats or stalls, can be reset after 5 minutes.
When will AUTO mode provide oxygen to the passenger masks?
When cabin altitude rises above 13,500 feet ± 500 feet.
What does a yellow CAWS DEICE BOOTS warning indicate?
Pressure in the boots is not reaching 11 PSI.
What will happen if the ejector fuel pump fails?
When low fuel pressure is sensed (below 2 PSI) and the Boost Pump switch is in the NORM position the electric, (fuel), boost pump will automatically engage (the FUEL PRESS annunciator will illuminate).
The hydraulic system for the gear will recharge when the pressure drops to what pressure.
2450 PSI.
